trans-unit.source: Provides minimal design-time support for <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManager"></xref> controls.

The ProxyWebPartManagerDesigner class is identical to the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.WebPartManagerDesigner> class and provides design-time support for <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManager> controls.
It appears on the design surface as a plain gray box showing the name of the class and the ID of the specific <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManager> control.

You can change the rendering of a custom <xref:System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManager> control by overriding the <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManagerDesigner.GetDesignTimeHtml%2A> method in the same manner as with any standard <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.ControlDesigner>.
The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManagerDesigner.UsePreviewControl%2A> property is overridden to always return `true`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManagerDesigner"></xref> class.
Gets an empty string (""), which indicates that the visual design environment should revert to default control rendering.
Binds the designer to the associated <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManager"></xref> control.
The <xref href="System.Web.UI.WebControls.WebParts.ProxyWebPartManager"></xref> control associated with the designer.
Gets a value indicating whether the designer should use a temporary copy rather than the actual control associated with the designer to generate the design-time markup.
